Article Title: Bihar: Nitish 10.0 takes oath with 14 mantris from BJP, 8 from JDU
Article Text:
JDU inducts only 8, none from core Kushwaha base, raises eyebrows

NEW DELHI/PATNA: As the swearing-in ceremony ended at Patna's Gandhi Maidan Thursday, CM Nitish Kumar took PM Modi 's hand and lifted it with his to greet a large cheering crowd, marking the new dynamic in their relationship since the JDU president rejoined NDA in Jan 2024.The transformation could not have been starker compared to their headline-grabbing photo-op in 2009 at a NDA rally in Ludhiana, which brought out the JDU chief's unease with the then Gujarat CM.The sight at Gandhi Maidan was a metaphor of the ease in their ties, emphasised in the presence of Modi, Union ministers Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh besides the gamut of chief ministers from BJP and allies.Nitish took oath along with 26 ministers, 14 from BJP, eight from JDU and four from three other allies as NDA looked to accommodate a diverse social coalition in an acknowledgement of its varied support base. They include three women and 10 first-timers, including seven from BJP, with the party rewarding its traditional voting bloc and new additions, while JDU has repeated its old hands, most of whom seen as long trusted aides of Nitish.The sea of saffron and BJP flags were punctuated with the green of JDU and flags of other allies at Gandhi Maidan, with chief ministers from the governing alliance turning up to lend political grandeur to an occasion seen as a high watermark for Nitish Kumar.PM Narendra Modi's gesture of waving gamcha at the end of the ceremony captured the triumphant mood.The PM later lauded the new dispensation as a wonderful team that would take the state to new heights. "Congratulations to Shri Nitish Kumar Ji on taking oath as Bihar's chief minister. He is an experienced administrator with a proven track record of good governance for many years," he said.While JDU's decision to induct only eight of its legislators, none from its core base of Kushwahas, into the government raised a few eyebrows, sources said the party would have more deliberation to fill in its quota when the Nitish cabinet, which can have a maximum strength of 36, is expanded, a neta said.Eight upper castes, six OBCs, seven EBCs, five Dalits and one lone Muslim in JDU MLA Zama Khan make up the new govt. Rajputs, whose share in the new assembly is the highest at 33 MLAs, have the maximum representation followed by two each from Bhumihars, Yadavs, Kurmis, including Nitish, Kushwahas and Nishads.BJP MLAs Samrat Choudhary, an OBC Kushwaha, and Vijay Kumar Sinha, an upper caste Bhumihar, have been retained as deputy CMs.RLM supremo Upendra Kushwaha turned to his son Deepak Prakash, who has little public profile and is not currently a member of either of the two legislators, to be his party's lone representative in govt. Kushwaha's wife Snehlata Kushwaha was elected an MLA in the poll.Santosh Kumar Suman, son of Union minister Jitam Ram Manjhi, will continue to represent HAM(S).BJP rewarded former Union minister Ram Kripal Yadav, a veteran of many difficult electoral battles who vanquished RJD's Ritlal Yadav in Danapur where party supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav held a rare roadshow, by inducting him as a minister.Its new faces include Shreyasi Singh, a former professional shooter, Sanjay Singh Tiger, and Rama Nishad. Nishad is the wife of Ajay Nishad, a former BJP MP who contested and lost on the Congress ticket in the 2024 Lok Sabha election, and her inclusion spotlights the party's efforts to cultivate Nishads, an important swing voting bloc in parts of the state.Old BJP hands like Mangal Pandey, Nitin Nabin and Dilip Jaiswal, who is also the state party president, joined seasoned JDU ministers like Bijendra Yadav, Shrawon Kumar, Vijay Kumar Chaudhary, Leshi Singh and Ashok Choudhary in govt.
Article Summary: JDU inducts only 8, none from core Kushwaha base, raises eyebrows. 26 ministers, 14 from BJP, eight from JDU and four from three other allies. They include three women and 10 first-timers, including seven from BJP.

Article Title: Bengaluru Robbery: Armed 'RBI officials' swipe off Rs 7 crore from cash van in 30 minutes
Article Text:
7cr from cash van on Dairy Circle flyover

Bengaluru Cash Van Robbed Of ₹7 Crore After Fake RBI Officers Trick Staff In A Filmy-Style Heist

8 special teams to probe case

BENGALURU: In one of the well-scripted daring daylight dacoities in Bengaluru, five to six miscreants posing as RBI officials looted Rs 7.1 crore from an armoured cash van from a busy flyover in south Bengaluru on Wednesday afternoon.The incident took place between 12.30pm and 1pm when the van, owned by CMS Info Systems, was moving cash in three boxes from HDFC Bank in JP Nagar to HBR Layout, 22km away. The stunning drama involved an MUV, two hatchbacks and the CMS-run armoured van.Read also: Bengaluru horror: Fake police hold cat at knifepoint, rob woman via UPI The drama started when a hatchback, a Maruti Zen, blocked the cash van near Ashoka Pillar, Jayanagar 2nd Block, around 12.30pm. Besides driver Binod Kumar, there were three occupants in the van: custodian Aftab and gunmen Rajanna & Tammaiah.Three men sprang out of the hatchback, which was tailed by an Innova, an MUV, and directed the van occupants : "We are RBI officials. There is a complaint against your firm for violating RBI guidelines. We have to record your statements."The CMS staff readily believed the imposters. The two gunmen Rajanna and Tammaiah left their licensed single-barrel guns in the vehicle and entered the MUV along with the custodian.One of the miscreants advised the cash van driver to go to Dairy Circle flyover — about 3km from Ashoka Pillar — and wait for “the RBI officials”. While Kumar drove ahead, the MUV with the CMS staff and miscreants closely followed the van. On reaching Nimhans junction, the MUV stopped.The miscreants directed the three CMS staffers to disembark: “Come to the police station and we’ll take your statements. Before that, we should take the cash boxes to the RBI.”The CMS staffers walked in the direction of Siddapura police station. Driver Kumar drove up to Dairy Circle flyover and waited there.“Soon, the MUV with miscreants stopped near Kumar. At gunpoint, miscreants shifted the cash boxes into another hatchback — a Maruti WagonR — for inspection by RBI. In the blink of an eye, the miscreants sped away, leaving behind Kumar, his van, and their MUV,” a police officer said.Read more: Bengaluru man slits estranged daughter-in-law’s throat in her sleep over unpaid loan; arrested Bengaluru City police commissioner Seemanth Kumar Singh said they are probing the case from all angles. “Unfortunately, there was a delay in CMS approaching us. Two deputy commissioners of police and one joint commissioner are leading eight special teams to crack thecase,” he said.Sanjay, a witness, claimed he saw a hatchback blocking the CMS van just ahead of Ashoka Pillar. “Then, an MUV that came from behind had the logo of the Indian govt on its front licence plate,” he said. Police discovered the licence plate (KA-03-NC-8052) was fake, and it is of a sedan owned by a person in Kalyannagar.Nataraj, senior security adviser from CMS, said he didn’t suspect any of his staffers and added that police investigation will reveal the men behind it. Vinod Chandrar, a branch manager of CMS, lodged a complaint late Wednesday night.
Article Summary: Five to six miscreants posing as RBI officials looted Rs 7.1 crore from an armoured cash van from a busy flyover in south Bengaluru on Wednesday afternoon. The incident took place between 12.30pm and 1pm when the van was moving cash in three boxes from HDFC Bank in JP Nagar to HBR Layout.

Article Title: Bihar Minister List 2025: Nitish Kumar sworn in as Bihar CM for 10th time - list of ministers who took oath today
Article Text:
File photo

Nitish Kumar To Take CM Oath For Record 10th Time At Patna's Gandhi Maidan, PM Modi To Attend

Full list of NDA ministers:

S.No. Name Party 1 Nitish Kumar JD(U) 2 Samrat Choudhary BJP 3 Vijay Kumar Sinha BJP 4 Vijay Kumar Choudhary JD(U) 5 Bijendra Prasad Yadav JD(U) 6 Shravan Kumar JD(U) 7 Mangal Pandey BJP 8 Dilip Kumar Jaiswal BJP 9 Ashok Choudhary JD(U) 10 Lesi Singh JD(U) 11 Madan Sahani JD(U) 12 Nitin Nabin BJP 13 Ram Kripal Yadav BJP 14 Santosh Kumar Suman HAM(S) 15 Sunil Kumar JD(U) 16 Mohammad Zama Khan JD(U) 17 Sanjay Singh Tigar BJP 18 Arun Shankar Prasad BJP 19 Surendra Mehta BJP 20 Narayan Prasad BJP 21 Rama Nishad BJP 22 Lakhendra Kumar Raushan BJP 23 Shreyashi Singh BJP 24 Pramod Kumar BJP 25 Sanjay Kumar LJP (RV) 26 Sanjay Kumar Singh LJP (RV) 27 Deepak Prakash RLM

NEW DELHI: JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar on Thursday took oath as the chief minister of Bihar for the 10th time at a grand ceremony held at Patna’s historic Gandhi Maidan."I congratulate my father for taking the oath as the CM the 10th time. The public gave us more than expected. I thank and also congratulate the public," Kumar said while taking oath.The swearing-in ceremony was attended by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, home minister Amit Shah, BJP president JP Nadda and several chief ministers from the ruling alliance marks the formation of the new NDA government following its landslide victory in the 2025 Assembly elections.Along with Nitish Kumar, 27 other ministers from NDA partners were also sworn in. The oath of office and secrecy to ministers was administered by Governor Arif Mohammed Khan.Nitish Kumar had resigned on Wednesday before staking claim to form a fresh government with NDA support. He was elected as the leader of both the JD(U) Legislature Party and the NDA Legislature Party during meetings with newly elected MLAs.BJP’s Samrat Choudhary and Vijay Kumar Sinha have been chosen as the leader and deputy leader of the BJP Legislature Party and are expected to continue in deputy CM roles.This is the fourth time Gandhi Maidan has hosted Nitish Kumar’s oath-taking ceremony, a venue closely associated with major political events in the state’s history. Elaborate security arrangements were made at the event, where lakhs of supporters gathered.The NDA swept 202 of the 243 seats in the state polls, securing a three-fourths majority. The election was seen as a crucial test for the 74-year-old Kumar who has remained central to Bihar’s politics for two decades. He first became chief minister in 2005 and has held the position continuously except for a brief nine-month period in 2014-15.The elections, held on November 6 and 11, saw a record voter turnout of 67.13%, with women voters surpassing men in participation. The results were announced on November 14.
Article Summary: JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar on Thursday took oath as the chief minister of Bihar for the 10th time. The swearing-in ceremony was attended by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, home minister Amit Shah, BJP president JP Nadda and several chief ministers from the ruling alliance.

Article Title: Narco-terror module busted in J-K: Father-son duo arrested from Handwara; 890g 'heroin', pistol seized
Article Text:
The duo, police said, were actively running a narco-terror network in the region.

SRINAGAR: Jammu & Kashmir Police said on Friday said they had busted a narco-terror module operating in the Qalamabad area of Handwara, about 100km north of Srinagar — a development that comes even as agencies nationwide are probing the November 10 Delhi car blast and the wider terror network involving Kashmiri operatives and doctors linked to the Faridabad module.Acting on specific intelligence about commercial-quantity narcotics and illegal weapons, police arrested one Shahnawaz Khan (23) and his father Abdul Lateef (53) from Puthwari, Nowgam, Handwara. The duo, police said, were “actively running a narco-terror network” in the region.Recoveries from their possession include:• A pistol with seven live rounds• Heroin-like contraband weighing around 890g“With the Handwara arrests, we expect more leads to emerge on cross-border financing and supply chains feeding larger terror conspiracies,” a senior police officer said.A case under Sections 8/21 of the NDPS Act, Sections 13, 18, 23, 39 of the UAPA, and Section 7/25 of the Arms Act has been registered at Qalamabad Police Station, he said.
Article Summary: Police arrested one Shahnawaz Khan (23) and his father Abdul Lateef (53) from Puthwari, Nowgam, Handwara. The duo, police said, were ‘actively running a narco-terror network’ in the region.Recoveries from their possession include:• A pistol with seven live rounds• Heroin-like contraband weighing around 890g.
